reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely loved this hotel!! It we easy access right onto Rt. 50 and the service is amazing! This place is very green and eco-friendly. It's a very chic hotel! Very well kept! The price was great too! I had stayed with my husband on a trip and it's just the right amount of space for two people. (We stayed in a King room 285 sq ft) The bed is one of the best beds I've ever stayed at in a hotel! I was extremely pleased and not knowing what to expect I was completely shocked at how amazing this hotel is! Best hotel for the Best price!! Definitely staying there again!
reviews.title: Best hotel for the Best price!

reviews.text: Great weekend rate of $80. friendly staff, but only 2 people for the whole place! Good location right off I 81
reviews.title: Typical Aloft

reviews.text: Very new hotel opened in March 2011. Standard Aloft decor, but a lot nicer staff. The hotel is very close to a mall (apple blossom). There is a small pool, which is indoor. Great price in the area (for hotels at the same level: Hampton Inn/HGI are close by). The top perk for me is Pet stay free!
reviews.title: Convenient located and great staff

reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and made a great recommendation for a nearby restaurant. The room was very clean, as was the pool area.
reviews.title: Fun time with family

reviews.text: I really like the room setups much better than traditional hotels.
reviews.title: I love this hotel

reviews.text: The Aloft hotel in Winchester is a modern, cool & hip place to stay at. The king size bed was comfortable, the curtains was clean and streamlined. Bathroom area was archtecturally interesting. The only problem is that the water leaked from the bathroom to the bedroom side, almost like a water fall. The mexican restaurant across the street was good.
reviews.title: hip & cool

reviews.text: I arrived at this hotel on a Saturday night and the first thing that welcomed me was the loud live music in the lobby. There seemed to be a party going on and it was hard to hear the staff's voice. The room was very trendy but somehow felt like a showroom fron Ikea. The room I stayed had a showerbooth but no bathtub.There was a small fridge and a safe. The bed was comfortable but was facing the window, so even with the blinds down, I had the sun in my eyes when I woke up. That's pretty annoying when you want to sleep more.
reviews.title: Trendy and Energetic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a chair at the desk which you'd probably want to be careful with because it scratches and tears off the wallpaper on the side. I'd sue the hotel if they'd ever charge me for the damage.
reviews.title: Trendy and a little silly.

reviews.text: The worst part was the cleaness of the carpet. When I walked on it bare footed after the shower, I went straight back to the shower to wash my feet again.
reviews.title: Aloft is a nice surprise and great addition to the Starwood brands

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even with the bad experience above, I still agree this is a trendy hotel, if that's what you're looking for. There is a device to connect yr laptop or dvd player to the flatscreen tv if you bring yr own cables and a usb slot for charging. There is an indoor swimming pool and a pool table in the lobby.
reviews.title: Just about perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel reminded me of a contemporary hotel I stayed in when in London (only cheaper). I really liked the modern decor and the bed was the most comfortable bed I think I have ever slept in! My only complaint was that it was noisy (loud music from a room on the 5th floor). Room needs more sound proofing.
reviews.title: Contemporary Euro Style Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As very frequent travelers we weren't expecting this type of hotel in a small town like Winchester, but we were pleasantly surprised during our 3 night stay. The rooms aren't large, but the layout is smart with modern styling. The blackout curtains are the best I've ever seen (as an RN who is usually switching between schedules this is an important variable to catching up on sleep). There is an HDMI input jack if you want to hook your laptop up to the giant flat screen (boyfriend loved this) for movie watching or using the free WIFI on the big screen. The bed was comfortable with good linens. Best of all, the place is pet friendly and has grass out front for your pooch! With multiple entrances every parking space (and there were plenty) were close. We didn't take advantage of the fitness center, but it had everything needed for a good workout with plenty of cardio and resistance machines as well as free-weights. The indoor pool is small, and frequently overrun with squealing children (but that's to be expected I suppose). As mentioned in other reviews, the bath products are good quality and dispensed in permanent fixtures rather than single use bottles. The only negative thing was when the staff lost our trip-extension information during shift change and we had to check-in twice when the housekeeper woke me up during a nap telling me to go downstairs and make a new reservation. PS There is not one, but three asian buffets across the street if you don't want to venture far for a meal.
reviews.title: Our Winchester Favorite

reviews.text: Wow, this place has great euro-style. We loved the room, the layout and the bathroom. The hotel kind of stands out in a rather low class neighborhood. What was really low class were the two employees we dealt with. I can't believe a place with this much style would hire people without any style. The bartender/bellhop was either drunk or stoned beyond belief! The desk girl would offer to take action only when pushed. The breakfast area was devoid of food. This Aloft has exciting but very poor execution!
reviews.title: Great style, strange staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a modern hotel located in the heart of Winchester. We got a really good rate on our room, much lower than other hotels in the area. Decor is very modern and nice, clean hotel. Pool is very small, but is indoor.
reviews.title: Great value in Winchester

reviews.text: This hotel is a step up from most along the Interstates. It has a funky modern feel (as do most W type hotels), and has very modern European type rooms. Not huge but well designed and practical. Good value too (I spent two nights, both booked and paid in advance at $75 and $84). This place is excellent value, has a bar, pool table area, pool, large exercise room, and very friendly staff. No free breakfast but for me that's not an issue since most of them I don't go for anyway. Would recommend this spot.
reviews.title: Modern and Fun, Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely new hotel, very clean, staff is very helpful. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Chic stay in Winchester

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here a couple nights on our way to CT and back. They allow you to bring your dog for a free of charge and deliver a bed and dog bowls to your room! The hotel itself is very nice and modern. It has a indoor pool and bigger than average fitness center for a hotel. They also have a bar, fireplace, pool table and cafe in the lobby. When we arrived I picked up a plate of cheese for two dollars then headed over to the bar for a nice glass of wine. The rooms are spacious for a boutique hotel and open, so there is no door on the bathroom. The beds were comfy, we had free wifi and a nice big stand up shower. Oh and free bottled water also. For 70 bucks a night you can't beat this deal.
reviews.title: Sleek, modern hotel out in the middle of the country
Not bad for a night but needs some work
reviews.text: The Winchester Aloft sticks out like a good thumb in a sore hand -- clearly the classiest place in a "Waffle House" neighborhood. No issues with cleanliness of the hotel and the room but the shower is horrible. The paper cup and tiny pencil are bush league. Bed wasn't very comfortable and you can't open a window and get fresh air. Great TV with many inputs. Electrical outlets are hard to find and you'd expect more in a newer place. Also the dark brown color is hard to find in the dark. These deficiencies are common to the Aloft brand but after enough feedback you'd think Starwood would get off its corporate hiney and make a few improvements. Trendy should not equate to chintzy. Staff was OK. This review makes the place sound worse than it really is but as a newer brand the issues should not be there. A bit noisy walls. Put it this way: the room isn't as nice as a newer Fairfield Inn or Courtyard or Hilton Garden Inn.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This seemed like too small a town for a boutique chain like aloft but we were sure glad to find it. Beautiful modern design in the lobby, rooms, bar and restaurant. Spacious and top of the line toiletries and linens. Nothing NOT to love!
reviews.title: (Unexpected) gorgeous boutique hotel in a small town!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was in Winchester for a wedding. This hotel is in the middle of several other chain hotels- nothing around it is of interest as far as food/drinks. Free parking- plentiful. Checking in was fine- they have the auto kiosk but the front desk was calling people over to them. I thought it was pretty fancy for a middle-of-no-where hotel. The rooms were very nice- comfortable bedding, nice modern, furniture and fixtures. The AC is a window type unit so there is some noise with that. Could not hear other guests though. The crowd of guests was pretty unusual- all walks of life- and it seems they allow animals- at least there was one shirtless guy in the lobby with a dog.
reviews.title: Slightly out of place for a trendy hotel
